__e: Mother, you just don't understand the kind of relationship that Darrin and I have.
I'm sorry to barge in at dinnertime but I had to drop these papers off for Darrin. And I'd like to--
I'm gonna stay here and wait for Darrin and do it all over again.
Darrin, only two minutes ago, you told me Sam was at home.
Darrin, you get down there this minute and don't take your eyes off him.
Now, look, Darrin, you should know by now that I say a lot of things I don't mean.
I see so little of Darrin, it's nice to have company.
Mother, if there's one thing I know about Darrin it's that he's strong and is in perfectly good health.
What I had to say to Darrin is between me and Darrin.
Well, I'm not that young, Ms. Randall, although most men in my position are a bit older, I guess.
Darrin is so power mad that he hasn't even got time to say hello to his children or have dinner with his wife.
You know where Darrin is so you're gonna bring me face to face with him to prove your point.
You see what I mean? Actually I do find the office more conducive, yes.
Don't you and Darwin have something to do somewhere else in the house?
Well you like your Great-uncle Albert, huh?
